SEARCH
Package view.gui

Class EndController

java.lang.Object
view.gui.EndController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class EndController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is the controller for the End.fxml file. It is responsible for the end screen of the game.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is called when the End.fxml file is loaded. It is responsible for setting the scoreBoard and username by calling the showScoreBoard method.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • showScoreBoard

      private void showScoreBoard()
      Method that shows the game results and the final grade of the player with all the objectives completed.

    • addCockadeToList

      private void addCockadeToList(javafx.scene.control.ListView cockadeList, Cockade cockade)

    • addChangeOfImage

      private void addChangeOfImage(javafx.scene.control.ListView cockadesList, int player)

    • handleCockadeSelection

      private void handleCockadeSelection(int player, String selectedCockade)
      Method that handles the selection of a cockade in the list. It shows the correct token next to the list of cockades of the player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player that completed the objective selected.
      selectedCockade - The cockade selected by the user.

    • goToLobbies

      private void goToLobbies(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Method that is called when the exit button is clicked. It is responsible for loading the MainMenu.fxml file.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Click of the exit button by the player.

    • returnToLoginMessage

      private void returnToLoginMessage()
      This method is responsible for printing the last view of the program if the server stopped. It interrupts the server thread, loads the MessageReturnToLogin.fxml file using FXMLLoader, sets the new scene to the stage, and displays the stage.

    • handleEvent

      private void handleEvent()
      Method that handles events received from the server. It first checks if there is an event available, and if not, it returns. If there is an event, it switches on the type of the event and performs the appropriate action. - ServerDisconnect: notifies the players that the server has been disconnected sending them to a scene explaining the situation
